svt_i2c_err_check Class Reference

Inheritance diagram for class svt_i2c_err_check:

List of all members.

Detailed Description

Derived sampling and checking class used by I2C Master/Slave components to register error checks.


Public Member Functions

function void  new ( string err_check_name = "", bit register_default_chks = 1, bit enable_default_chks = 1, string full_name = "default_name" )
function void  register_default_checks ( bit enable_checks = 1 )
function void  report_failures ( bit [SVT_I2C_MAX_RULE:0] rule )

Member Function Documentation

  function void
 svt_i2c_err_check::new
 (  string err_check_name = "", bit register_default_chks = 1, bit enable_default_chks = 1, string full_name = "default_name"  ) 

CONSTRUCTOR: Create a new svt_i2c_err_check instance.

err_check_name - A string that identifies this particular svt_err_check instance.

register_default_chks - A bit that identifies whether or not the default checks associated with this sampling/checking class should be registered automatically.

enable_default_chks - A bit that identifies whether or not the default checks associated with this sampling/checking class should be enabled. This bit only has meaning if register_default_checks is set to 1.

  function void
 svt_i2c_err_check::register_default_checks
 (  bit enable_checks = 1  ) 

This method is called by the constructor if the register_default_checks parameter is set to 1.

enable_checks - A bit that identifies whether or not the checks that are registered by this function should be enabled or disabled.

  function void
 svt_i2c_err_check::report_failures
 (  bit [SVT_I2C_MAX_RULE:0] rule  ) 

Member Attribute Documentation

 svt_err_check_stats  attribute
 svt_i2c_err_check::i2c_10b_slv_addr_fst_rd_cmd

Check : This error is triggered when 10 bit slave id First Byte should be write command if the slave was not already adderssed

 svt_err_check_stats  attribute
 svt_i2c_err_check::i2c_ack_received_for_invalid_slave_id

Check : This error is triggered when ACK should not be received for reserved SLAVE ID.

 svt_err_check_stats  attribute
 svt_i2c_err_check::i2c_ack_to_invalid_second_byte_after_gen_call

Check : This error is triggered when Ack is received for Second byte other than 8'h04 or 8'h06 with LSB as 0, after general call.

 svt_err_check_stats  attribute
 svt_i2c_err_check::i2c_add_mode_cci

Check : This error is triggered when 10-bit addressing is used in CCI Mode.

 svt_err_check_stats  attribute
 svt_i2c_err_check::i2c_bit_level_clk_stretch_in_hs

Check : This error is triggered when Bit Level Clock Stretching is detected in HS mode.

 svt_i2c_err_check::i2c_dsize_size_8_bit

Check : This error is triggered when Complete data byte not transmitted.

 svt_err_check_stats  attribute
 svt_i2c_err_check::i2c_general_call_followed_by_0000_0000

Check : This error is triggered when General call should not be followed by 8'b0000_0000.

 svt_i2c_err_check::i2c_xz_scl

 svt_i2c_err_check::i2c_xz_sda

 svt_err_check_stats  attribute
 svt_i2c_err_check::i3c_ack_brdcst_wr

Check : All I3C Slaves must ACK the Broadcast Write (0x7E+W).

 svt_err_check_stats  attribute
 svt_i2c_err_check::i3c_addr_header_after_repeated_start

Check : This error is triggered if address header following repeated Start is not driven on SDA using Push Pull.

 svt_err_check_stats  attribute
 svt_i2c_err_check::i3c_dyn_addr_tbit

Check : This error is triggered in the case of Dynamic Addressing (SETDASA/ENTDAA), when master sends T-Bit.

 svt_err_check_stats  attribute
 svt_i2c_err_check::i3c_entdaa_tbit

Check : This error is triggered in the case of ENTDAA CCC, when master sends T-Bit.

 svt_err_check_stats  attribute
 svt_i2c_err_check::i3c_hotjoin_bus_idle_time

Check : This error is triggered if Hot-Join request comes before 1ms of "Bus Idle" time.

 svt_err_check_stats  attribute
 svt_i2c_err_check::i3c_incorrect_ack_on_addr_already_changed_by_setdasa

Check : This error is triggered if a slave ACKs its static address and does not operate as I3C slave after getting dynamic address through SETDASA.

 svt_err_check_stats  attribute
 svt_i2c_err_check::i3c_invalid_dynamic_address

Check : This error is triggered when an invalid dynamic address is assigned by SETDASA, SETNEWDA, Direct RSTDAA or ENTDAA command during run time.

 svt_err_check_stats  attribute
 svt_i2c_err_check::i3c_master_stops_entdaa_after_two_nack

Check : This error is triggered if main master does not stop ENTDAA after 2 NACKs.

 svt_err_check_stats  attribute
 svt_i2c_err_check::i3c_rd_tbit_0_no_stop_sr

Check : This error is triggered when master doesnot generate STOP/Sr after slave sends 0 in T-bit for READ.
